ratings.comment: Seemed disorganized and more interested in talking about topics from advanced calculus than teaching 234.  The Russian accent didn't help either.

better pray you have a good TA for this class. take my advice: don't even bother going to lecture. you can try understand stuff but you most likely won't. exams aren't too bad; they're like what other profs would have. this guy has awesome fanny pack though. he's quite a character but not worth having as a teacher

Very poor teacher, lecture was boring and impossible to understand. He is brilliant, but disorganized and doesn't know how to communicate the material. The one good part about being in class was his random analogies, but those didn't make sense in regards to what he was trying to explain. Overall, avoid him because pretty much anyone else is better

There is no use to go to his lecture. because you absolutely learn nothing from lecture and cannot understand his accent at all. Heavily rely on books and TAs. He had a exam question that no one in the class got it right. I learned nothing from this class.
This professor is to smart for his own good does not know how to relate to people.

Absolutely terrible teacher. I'm sure he's a brilliant mathematician but skipping his lectures actually was beneficial for me. He really likes to use useless proofs and speaks some language that is not English.
Lectures are very confusing, does not use a textbook. Has a strong emphasis on trig functions. Although he may appear very difficult, if you put the time in the exams are not too difficult.
Lectures were horribly unorganized and hard to follow.  Needed to rely heavily on book and TA.

In this class I was not tested on my ability to solve abstract algebra problems.  Instead I was tested on how well I could memorize proofs that he did in class.  Got an A for memory but F for understanding.  In this respect it was an easy A but I learned nothing.
In Russia, the solution of the 4th degree Taylor polynomial finds you.

Utterly useless. Literally the most ineffective teacher I have ever had. Absolutely no one goes to lecture because it doesn't help. The ONLY way to do well is to teach yourself and PRAY for a good TA. Midterms are generally fair, but the final is no joke.

Literally awful. I took AP Calc BC in high school, and expected a review. Not even close. All of the basic concepts that build understanding are completely skipped. The exams are only 5 or 6 questions with little partial credit and his accent is impossible. Unless you're a math whiz and can learn well on your own be wary of "the most failed class"

Hardest class I have taken thus far in college. First day, he struck me as a funny character with a sweet accent and a fanny pack(!). Novelty wore off when I couldn't understand the lessons. Progression of curriculum makes material harder than it should be, and unless you have a good TA you'd better be prepared to teach yourself a lot.
Not bad. Would say exactly what was on the exams. Bad accent, but can understand, just have to listen carefully. Very clear notes.

HE is soooo difficult to understand. Terrible accent. Makes is difficult to comprehend material. Some lectures were a complete waste of time, not only because it didn't make sense but because  we were never even tested on it. exams are fair

Prof. Nazarov is overall a good teacher. Pros: always helpful in OH, clear notes, explains things rigorously. Cons: never returns homework/tests, tells you almost exactly what is going to be on the test...  Question: What is in that fanny pack anyways?
